name: AJR
description:
is an American pop band founded by brothers {{nowrap|[[Adam Met|Adam]], Jack, and Ryan}} Met ({{Ne|Metzger}}), collectively a trio of vocalists, {{nowrap|multi-instrumentalists}}, and songwriters. In the 2010s and the early 2020s, the cross-genre [[Trio (music)|trio]] of the 21st century in music has recorded [[List of songs recorded by AJR|over 100 songs]] and has released five studio albums on various record labels along with their [[indie label]].{{efn|name=labels|{{Timeline of release years

Born in New York City, where the brothers primarily focused on [[busking]], [[tap dancing]], and singing covers in their preteen years, started in 2005. After shifting to songwriting at college, AJR wrote "[[I'm Ready (AJR song)|I'm Ready]]" and promoted the song on Twitter in 2012, which drew a surprising referral from Australian singer and songwriter [[Sia]] to her [[Band manager|talent management]] network; then a record label named AJR Productions was formed. AJR has released three more [[indie pop]] EPs—''[[Infinity (AJR EP)|Infinity]]'' (2014), ''[[What Everyone's Thinking]]'' (2016), and ''[[What No One's Thinking]]'' (2025)—since the song was released on ''[[6foot1]]'' (2013) as well as the [[reissue]] ''I'm Ready EP'' (2014).

At their home studio, AJR has written or co-written every song in their [[AJR discography#Studio albums|five-album discography]]: ''[[Living Room (AJR album)|Living Room]]'' (2015); ''[[The Click (album)|The Click]]'' (2017); the two U.S. [[Billboard 200|''Billboard'' 200]] top-ten albums—''[[Neotheater]]'' (2019), ''[[OK Orchestra]]'' (2021); and ''[[The Maybe Man]]'' (2023). The 2017 [[electropop]] platinum album contained their first [[List of Billboard Alternative Songs number ones of the 2010s|''Billboard'' Alternative number-one song]] "[[Sober Up]]" (featuring [[Rivers Cuomo]]), and the 2021 [[orchestral pop]] gold album spawned—their first [[List of Billboard Hot 100 top-ten singles in 2021|Hot 100 top-ten single]] and the [[Billboard Music Award for Top Rock Song#Bang!|''Billboard'' Music Award Top Rock Song]]—"[[Bang! (AJR song)|Bang!]]". [[The Maybe Man Tour|The accompanying arena concert tour of the 2023 album]]  was listed on the top 100 tours of 2024 in ticket sales.

AJR is a {{nowrap|[[multi-platinum]]}} band for having eight platinum singles—including the three aforementioned songs; "[[Weak (AJR song)|Weak]]", "[[Burn the House Down (song)|Burn the House Down]]", "[[100 Bad Days]]", "[[Way Less Sad]]", and "[[World's Smallest Violin]]"—all of which account for nineteen million [[Recording Industry Association of America#"Digital" single certification|certified units]] of their digital single sales in America.
